summary: The Post-Disaster Reforestation and Restoration Act of 2025 mandates the Secretary of the Interior to establish a program for reforestation and restoration on covered lands following unplanned disturbances. The Secretary will identify lands needing assistance, propose priority projects to be carried out through grants, contracts, and agreements, and conduct outreach to relevant stakeholders. The bill also requires annual reports to Congress detailing project progress, funding, and recommendations to address reforestation and restoration gaps. The act defines key terms like "covered agency," "covered lands," and "unplanned disturbance."
